snippet: Middle Eastern, South Asian and African immigrants have streamed across the 126-mile border between Turkey and Greece into the European Union, making its member countries resentful.
abstract: Middle Eastern, South Asian and African immigrants have streamed across the border between Turkey and Greece into the European Union, causing resentment in member countries; the flow has raised tensions throughout Europe, to the point where the top French official responsible for immigration seriously suggested that a wall be built along the entire border; in Greece, one person in 20 is estimated to be there illegally.

byline.contributor: Rachel Donadio contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: Middle Eastern, South Asian and African immigrants have streamed across the 126-mile border between Turkey and Greece into the European Union, making its member countries resentful.

headline.seo: Illegal Immigrants Slip Into Europe by Way of Greek Border
headline.main: For Illegal Immigrants, Greek Border Offers a Back Door to Europe
headline.print_headline: For Illegal Immigrants, Greek Border Offers a Back Door to Europe
